name: Agile Steering
description: Enable or disable the Agile Steering feature. Agile Steering provides quick steering response for vehicle maneuverability. Only use this function when the user explicitly mentions the Agile Steering feature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Heating Gear Position Query
description: Query the current gear position settings of seat heating.

name: Electric Tailgate Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's electric tailgate.

action.description: Switch status including [open, close]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as open/close.

name: Steering Wheel Assist Mode Query
description: Query the current setting mode of steering wheel steering assist.

enum: check steering wheel steering assist status

name: Rearview Mirror Switch Status Query
description: Query the switch status of the rearview mirror.

name: Steering Wheel Heating Switch Status Check
description: Check the on/off status of steering wheel heating.

name: Steering Wheel Assist Mode Settings
description: Adjust steering wheel assist mode (steering effort intensity), including Comfort, Standard, and Sport modes.
usage: Select appropriate assist mode based on user requirements.  'The steering wheel is too heavy when turning, requires significant force to rotate' indicates need to set assist mode to Comfort.  'Help me directly link the steering wheel weight to Sport mode' indicates need to set steering wheel assist mode to Sport.

name: Steering Wheel Heating Level Query
description: Check the current heating level setting of the steering wheel heating.

name: Steering Wheel Assistance Settings Page
description: Open or close the steering wheel assistance settings page.
usage: Opening the steering wheel assistance settings page allows users to adjust related assistance settings. Example: 'The steering wheel is hard to turn, enable the settings' indicates opening this page. 'This steering wheel is too heavy, show the assistance settings adjustments' indicates opening this page. Exiting the steering wheel assistance adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Heating Settings Page
description: Open or close the settings page for seat heating functionality.
usage: Opening the seat heating settings page allows users to view or adjust related heating features.  When seat heating adjustment is possible, open the seat heating settings page.  Exiting seat heating adjustment indicates closing the seat heating settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: HUD Mode Settings
description: Configure modes for HeadUp Display (HUD), including AR mode, Minimalist mode, 2D mode, and 3D mode.
usage: HUD projects critical information (such as vehicle speed, navigation instructions, warning messages, etc.) directly onto the windshield (projection in front of users, projection in front of windshield), serving as a virtual screen in front of the driver's seat.

name: Steering Wheel Custom Button
description: Enable or disable the steering wheel custom button functionality.
usage: Enable the steering wheel custom button functionality to directly enter button customization mode.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Switch Status Query
description: Query the switch status of seat massage.

name: Steering Wheel Auto Heating Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the steering wheel auto heating mode.
usage: Enabling the steering wheel auto heating function can automatically heat the steering wheel based on ambient temperature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Ventilation Switch Status Query
description: Query the switch status of seat ventilation.

name: Seat Massage Time Setting
description: Set the duration for seat massage, allowing configuration of specific minutes or continuous operation. Examples: 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, or continuous massage.

value.description: Massage duration. Two formats:  Specific time value in HH:MM:SS format.  Nonspecific time value. Optional value [continuous]. Output default 'N/A' when unable to determine specific time or continuous operation.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) for application. Must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default ["CUR"].

name: Streaming Media Rearview Mirror Switch Control
description: Open or close the streaming media rearview mirror (electronic rearview mirror).
usage: When the rear screen is activated, it may block the interior rearview mirror. In this case, the streaming media rearview mirror can be opened, which will display vehicle rearview image information on the main screen, facilitating driver observation.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat massage feature settings page.
usage: Opening the seat massage settings page allows users to view and customize adjustments related to massage settings according to personal preferences. Exiting the massage adjustment interface indicates closing the seat massage settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Leg Rest Control
description: Open or close the seat leg rest.
usage: Opens the seat leg rest by extending it from the seat base. Closes the seat leg rest by folding/retracting it.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Target seat positions, must be output as list. Return default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Never hallucinate positions.

name: Seat Lumbar Support Setting Page
description: Open or close the seat lumbar support setting page.
usage: By opening the seat lumbar support setting page, users can manually finetune the position and intensity of the lumbar support.  When users experience lumbar discomfort and need to access settings, they can open this page for manual adjustments.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Steering Wheel Heating Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the steering wheel heating function. Only supported on the driver's side.
usage:
Activating the steering wheel heating increases surface temperature, suitable for cold winter driving conditions.
 When the driver feels cold hands, enable steering wheel heating.
 User expressions like 'hands are sweating, turn off heating' indicate closing steering wheel heating.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.
mapping_rules: 'hands are sweating, turn off heating'  off

name: HUD Height Adjustment
description: Adjust the height of HeadUp Display (HUD). 1. Support setting HUD to specific height values. 2. Support raising or lowering HUD height. 3. Support setting HUD to maximum/minimum height.
usage: HUD projects critical information (e.g. vehicle speed, navigation prompts, warning messages) directly onto the windshield, allowing users to adjust the display height on the windshield according to their needs.

value.description: Height adjustment value for HUD display, expressed in three formats:  When setting absolute height: use [positive integer] with value range 1n.  When setting relative adjustment: use [+/positive integer] with value range 1n, where '+' indicates height increase and '' indicates height decrease.  When setting limit values: optional values [max, min], where 'max' represents maximum height and 'min' represents minimum height. Output default value 'N/A' when HUD height adjustment value cannot be determined.

name: Seat Memory Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat memory settings page.
usage: Open this page to view memorized seat positions, or manually save current seat position as a memory position, recall previously saved seat memory positions. Open this page when users need to view current seat memory positions. Open this page when users want to know how to memorize current positions. Open this page when users want to learn how to use seat memory functionality. Closing seat memory adjustment interface indicates exiting this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: HUD Parameter Saving and Restoring
description: Used to save or restore the angle/height parameters of the HeadUp Display (HUD).
usage: 'HUD' allows users to save current angle/height settings to the system for future invocation when needed.  'HUD' enables users to restore memorized angle/height profiles in the system, eliminating the need for repeated HUD parameter adjustments each time the vehicle starts. For example, when a user wants to adjust HUD angles, this function can restore HUD angles to complete the adjustment.

name: Seat Rotation Reset
description: The seat rotation reset function restores the seat's overall direction to 0 degrees (facing directly forward state). Only supports the second row seats.
usage: The seat rotation reset function does not restore seat angles, but resets rotated seats to their original overall directional position.

name: Seat Adjustment Page Control
description: Open or close the seat page. The seat page provides all setting information of the current seat, allowing users to manually modify and adjust.
usage: Open this page when users ask where to manually adjust seat position, height, backrest, lumbar support, massage, leg rest, seat heating, or seat ventilation.  Closing the seat adjustment interface indicates exiting this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Ventilation Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat ventilation settings page. Opening the ventilation settings page allows users to view or modify settings related to seat ventilation according to their preferences. For example, this page displays the seat ventilation functionality, current ventilation mode, ventilation intensity levels, etc.

name: Steering Wheel ReturntoCenter Alert Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the steering wheel returntocenter alert (reminder) function.
usage: This feature helps users more accurately determine whether the steering wheel is currently centered.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Auto Ventilation Switch Control
description: Turns on/off seat auto ventilation mode, which controls the automatic ventilation adjustment for seats. The auto ventilation mode automatically adjusts ventilation levels based on seat temperature conditions.

position.description: Affected invehicle positions, output must be list format. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do NOT hallucinate positions.

name: Steering Wheel Heating Settings Page
description: Open or close the steering wheel heating settings page.
usage: Opening the steering wheel heating settings page allows users to view or modify specific heating configurations. For example, '' indicates opening the steering wheel heating settings page. Exiting steering wheel heating adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: HUD Switch Control
description: Open or close the HeadUp Display (HUD) functionality.
usage: HUD projects key information (such as vehicle speed, navigation indications, warning messages, etc.) directly onto the windshield (projection in front of the user, projection in front of the windshield), serving as a virtual screen in front of the driver. Users can obtain important information faster without lowering their head to check the instrument cluster or central control screen, enabling timely responses. For example, '' indicates turning on the HUD.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when the action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Easy Entry Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the seat easy entry function. Seat easy entry = Seat Welcome | Seat Entry Assist | Seat Comfort Mode | Seat Auto Front/Rear Adjustment Function.
usage: This feature will automatically adjust seat position during user entry/exit for convenience.  Close seat easy entry when: 1. User considers current position appropriate and requires no adjustment 2. User explicitly states not to change current position.  Enable seat easy entry function when friends frequently use the vehicle, facilitating passenger entry/exit.  Activate this function when seat obstruction occurs or entry/exit becomes inconvenient.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Affected seat positions, must output as list. Default to ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Do NOT fabricate values.

name: Steering Wheel Driving Linkage Mode Control
description: Open or close the steering wheel driving linkage mode.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Rearview Mirror Tilt Control During Reversing
description: Enable or disable the automatic tilt function of rearview mirrors during reversing.
usage: When enabled, rearview mirrors (door mirrors/exterior mirrors) will automatically tilt during reversing to provide better ground visibility, reduce blind spots, and assist parking. When disabled, mirrors return to standard positions. Activate tilt function when users can't see garage lines while reversing.

action.description: Operation status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Rotation Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat rotation settings page.
usage: The seat rotation settings page provides a detailed adjustment guidance interface for seat rotation. Exiting the seat rotation adjustment interface indicates closing the seat rotation settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

page.description: Optional values [page, settings]. Select based on user expressions.

name: Steering Wheel Temperature Adjustment
description: Adjust the temperature (heating level) of the steering wheel. 1. Supports increasing or decreasing steering wheel temperature. 2. Supports setting steering wheel temperature to specific levels (natural numbers). 3. Supports adjusting steering wheel temperature to maximum or minimum levels.
usage: This feature modifies the driver's hand temperature perception.  Lower steering wheel temperature when users feel it's too hot.  Increase steering wheel temperature when users feel too cold or report cold hands.

value.description: Steering wheel temperature adjustment value with three formats:  Absolute temperature specified as integer [030]  Relative adjustment using [+/integer] format [130], where '+ ' means increase and '' means decrease  Special values [max, min] indicating maximum/minimum temperature. Default 'N/A' when value cannot be determined.

name: Seat Leg Rest Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat leg rest settings page.
usage: Opening this page allows users to view and manually adjust seat leg rest height or position based on personal preferences. Exiting leg rest adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Super Lock Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's super lock.

action.description: Switch status including on, off.

name: Rearview Mirror Settings Page
description: Open or close the rearview mirror settings page.
usage: Open the rearview mirror settings page to allow users to adjust mirror configurations according to personal preferences. Exiting the mirror adjustment interface indicates closing the rearview mirror settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Steering Wheel Assist Switch Control
description: Turn on or off steering wheel assist (steering assist).
usage: Steering wheel assist helps users with steering and controls the steering wheel more easily.  Activating steering assist functionality indicates enabling this feature. Disabling steering wheel assist indicates turning off this feature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the seat massage function.
usage: Open massage function when users want to relieve physical fatigue and relax muscles. Key scenarios:  'press' generally refers to 'massage'. 'stop pressing' indicates need to turn off massage.

action.description: Switch status including on, off, pause.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) where function applies, must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do NOT output invalid positions.

name: Interior Rearview Mirror AutoDimming Control
description: Enable or disable the autodimming function of the interior rearview mirror.
usage: When rear vehicle lights are excessively strong, this feature automatically adjusts the mirror's reflectivity to reduce the intensity of reflected light and prevent driver eye irritation caused by intense glare.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Steering Wheel Custom Button Settings Page
description: Open or close the steering wheel custom button settings page.
usage: Open this page to allow users to view or modify the status and settings of buttons on the steering wheel. Exiting the steering wheel custom button setup indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Backrest Angle Adjustment
description: Adjust the angle of the seat backrest to specific numerical values within the range between 90 and 150 degrees.
usage: Users can utilize this function to precisely adjust backrest angles according to their requirements. For example: setting the backrest to a comfortable angle (120 degrees).

value.description: Backrest angle represented as positive integer within [90, 150] range.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) must be output as list. Output default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Seat Cushion Flattening Settings
description: Used to flatten the seat cushion.
usage: Activates when users require the seat cushion to be horizontal. Use this function to flatten the cushion when tilt adjustment is not desired.

position.description: The vehicle positions where the function applies. Output must be a list. When seat positions cannot be determined, strictly output default value ["CUR"] without speculation.

name: HUD Brightness Adjustment
description: Adjust the display brightness of the HeadUp Display (HUD). 1. Supports setting HUD to specific brightness values (percentage). 2. Supports increasing or decreasing HUD brightness (e.g. darken a bit, brighten some, adjust 10%). 3. Supports setting HUD to maximum or minimum brightness.
usage: Projects critical information (e.g. speed, navigation prompts, warnings) directly onto the windshield. Users can adjust displayed brightness on the windshield as needed.  Lower HUD brightness when eyes get tired after prolonged viewing.  'The projection on the front glass is too glaring' indicates need to reduce HUD brightness.

value.description: HUD brightness adjustment value with three representation formats:  Absolute value: percentage format (1%99%) when setting specific brightness.  Relative adjustment: +/ percentage format [0%, 100%]. '+' means increase, '' means decrease.  Extreme values: 'max' for maximum brightness, 'min' for minimum brightness. Output default 'N/A' when HUD brightness value cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: Just slightly increase HUD brightness  min

name: HUD Additional Features
description: Enable or disable additional functions for the HeadUp Display (HUD), including snow mode, map view, lyrics display, and multilane.
usage: The snow mode function adjusts HUD display parameters to ensure information remains clearly visible in snowy or highcontrast lighting environments, thereby improving driving safety and comfort.  The map view feature provides navigation assistance in the HUD interface for better environmental awareness.  The lyrics display function shows currently played music lyrics on the HUD.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Gear Query
description: Check the current gear setting of seat massage.

name: Bed Mode Switch Control
description: Open or close the bed mode for invehicle seats, supporting only front row, rear row, or entire vehicle bed modes.
usage: Bed mode = Bed formation mode. When this mode is activated, invehicle seats will automatically adjust to flatten backrests and connect into a bed. Use this function when users explicitly mention needing to convert seats into a bed.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Target seat positions in vehicle, must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate content and must output default value ["CUR"].

name: Seat OneClick FacetoFace
description: Simultaneously rotates both seats 180 degrees to achieve facetoface positioning. Only applicable to secondrow seats.
usage: Execute the oneclick facetoface function when users want to rotate secondrow seats to make left and right seats face each other.

name: Seat Rotation Angle Adjustment
description: Rotate the seat. 1. Supports specifying rotation angles (0360). 2. Supports unspecified rotation angles.
extra_rag_text: Supports rotating the seat xx degrees to the left or right.

value.description: Rotation angle of the seat, represented as a positive integer within range [0, 360]. Output default value 'NULL' when angle is not specified.

position.description: Vehicle position where the action applies. Output must be a list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate values  must output default value ["CUR"].

name: Seat Heating Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the heated seat function.
usage: Heated seats will warm the seating surface, suitable for cold weather conditions. Supports heating for driver seat, passenger seat, second row, and third row seats. Note: 'Seat heating' is not equivalent to cabin heating.  Activate seat heating when the weather is cold or users feel the seat/coolness in the hip area requires warmth.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Target seat positions in the vehicle. Must output as list. Use default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Seat Memory Position Save
description: Save current seat position (seat parameters) to the system.
usage: This function allows users to save the current seat position as a specific memory number.

memlocation.description: Numeric memory number specified for saving, represented as positive integer. Output default value 'NULL' when user does not specify a numeric location.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected, output must be a list. Do not infer seat position when uncertain, must output default value ["CUR"].

name: HUD Mode Switching
description: Switch modes of the HeadUp Display (HUD), supporting switching to unspecified mode, previous mode, or next mode.
usage: HUD projects critical information (such as vehicle speed, navigation indicators, warning messages, etc.) directly onto the windshield (projection in front of the user, projection before the windshield), serving as the virtual screen in front of the driver. This function allows users to switch HUD modes according to current scenarios.

number.description: Target mode identifier for switching. '1' indicates switching to previous mode, '+1' indicates switching to next mode. Output default value 'NULL' when user doesn't specify 'previous' or 'next' mode switching.

name: Seat Fold Switch Control
description: Activate or deactivate the seat back folding function. Closing the seat = activating seat folding; unfolding the seat = opening the seat = deactivating seat folding.
usage: When the user wants to open the seat at xx position, it indicates closing the seat fold at xx position.  When the user wants to close the seat at xx position, it indicates opening the seat fold at xx position.

action.description: Switch status including on and off.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do NOT generate values spontaneously.

name: Steering Wheel Assistance Gear Adjustment
description: Adjust the gear position of steering wheel assistance (steering assistance force intensity). 1. Supports increasing or decreasing steering assistance gear position (singlestep/multistep). 2. Supports adjusting steering wheel assistance to specific numerical values (natural numbers) or preset gears (high, medium, low three gears). 3. Supports adjusting steering wheel assistance gear position to maximum or minimum level.
usage: Adjust steering wheel assistance gear position through this function to help users find suitable steering feel and easily adapt to different driving scenarios. 'Lighten steering wheel assistance' indicates setting steering wheel assistance to low gear.

value.description: Adjustment value for steering wheel assistance gear. Three representation formats:  Set to specific gear value (natural number) or percentage (n/n%), e.g. adjust to gear n or n%.  Increase/decrease assistance level. Define '+' as increase one step, '' as decrease one step. '+n'|'+n%' means increase n gears/n%, 'n'|'n%' means decrease n gears/n%. Integer range [1, n], percentage range [0%, 100%].  Preset gear positions: [max, high, mid, low, min] representing maximum, high, medium, low, minimum gears respectively. Output default 'N/A' when adjustment value cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: Raise steering assistance by one gear +1
Lower steering assistance by one gear 1

name: Seat Cushion Angle Adjustment
description: Adjust the angle of seat cushion. 1. Supports raising or lowering seat cushion angle. 2. Sets cushion to specified angle. 3. Adjust seat cushion tilt angle to maximum or minimum.
usage: Raise seat cushion angle when it's too low.  Lower seat cushion angle when it's too high.

value.description: Adjustment value for seat cushion angle. Three representations:  Set to specific angle (unsigned integer n in range [0,90]).  Raise/lower angle: '+n' means raise n degrees, 'n' means lower n degrees.  Preset positions: [max, min]. Output default 'N/A' when adjustment value is indeterminate.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Must output as list. Default ["CUR"] when position is indeterminate.

name: Seat Automatic Heating Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the seat automatic heating mode. Only use this function when the user explicitly requires seat automatic heating.
usage: The seat automatic heating function will automatically activate heating when seat temperature is low, eliminating manual operation. When weather turns cold, users may want to enable seat automatic heating to maintain comfortable seating temperature automatically.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected, must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do not hallucinate values.

name: Rearview Mirror Fold Control
description: Open or close the automatic folding/reverse tilting function for rearview mirrors (side mirrors, external mirrors) without requiring position specification.

position.description: Control position with options [NULL, left, right, all]. Output default value 'NULL' when unable to determine or user doesn't specify mirror side.

name: Seat Heating Duration Setting
description: Set the duration for seat heating, allowing configuration for specific minutes or continuous heating. Examples include 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, or continuous heating.

value.description: Heating duration. Two representation formats:  Specific time value in HH:MM:SS format  Nonspecific duration value with optional value [continuous]. Output default value 'N/A' when specific time or continuous status cannot be determined.

position.description: Vehicle position where the setting applies. Must output as a list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"] without neutral expressions.

name: Seat Massage Mode Adjustment
description: Adjust seat massage modes, supporting full body, back, lumbar, and hip (buttocks) massage modes including full body activation, full body relaxation, lumbarback stretching, hip relief, etc. This feature allows users to select different massage modes according to personal preferences or needs.
usage: Phrases like 'My back is stiff' or 'Give me a back massage to relax' indicate need to activate back massage.  Mentioning 'massage hips' indicates need to activate hip massage.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

mode.description: Massage mode. Accurately match massage modes according to user expressions.

position.description: Affected seat positions in vehicle. Must output as list. Output default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Never hallucinate values.

name: Trunk Switch Control
description: Open, close, or pause the trunk (trunk door).
usage: The trunk is also referred to as luggage compartment, luggage cabin, or luggage compartment window.  Open the trunk when the user wants to store luggage items.  Close the trunk after completing luggage storage.  Pause the trunk when controlling its opening/closing angle. Pausing the trunk maintains its current position.

action.description: Switch status including [open, close, pause]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as open/close/pause.
mapping_rules: “Can the trunk be paused at this height”  pause

name: Seat Backrest Direction Adjustment
description: Adjust the direction of seat backrest (seat angle), including forward, backward, neutral, upward, and downward. This function meets users' need to adjust backrest position: forward/upward adjustment makes the seat more upright, backward/downward adjustment makes the seat flatter.
usage: Backrest = backrest support = backrest inflation components.  Adjust backrest upward when users feel the backrest is too low.  Adjust backrest upward when users want a more upright position.  Adjust backrest downward when users want a lower position.  Adjust seat direction based on user feedback when seat angle is uncomfortable.  Backrest adjustment to maximum upper position (frontmost/highest) achieves upright seating effect.  Backrest adjustment to maximum lower position (rearmost/lowest) achieves fully reclined position.  'Flattening' means adjusting backrest to rearmost position; requiring forward adjustment to restore upright position after flattening.

value.description: Backrest adjustment directions with options[up, down, forward, backward]. Up/Forward directions indicate backrest raising/forward tilting (reducing seat angle), Down/Backward directions indicate backrest lowering/rear tilting (increasing seat angle) for flattening. Forward adjustment required after flattening to restore upright position.
mapping_rules: 'Help me flatten seat. Raise seat'  forward

direction_range.description: Specifies backrest adjustment range.  Use percentage (0%100%) when numerical value specified.  Output 'max' when extreme position required without specified value.  Output default 'NULL' when user specifies degree adverbs like 'a bit'/'slightly'/'some'.
mapping_rules: 'Help me flatten seat. Raise seat'  max

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Must output as list. Use default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Seat Direction Limit Adjustment
description: This function supports adjusting the seat to the foremost and rearmost positions, i.e., the extreme/end positions.
usage: Open when users require maximum leg room by sliding the seat to the rearmost position. Example: 'I want to extend my legs and move the seat all the way back' indicates moving the current seat to the rearmost position.

value.description: Direction of seat movement. Optional values [forward, backward]. Output default 'N/A' when movement direction cannot be determined.

position.description: Target seat position(s) in vehicle. Output must be a list. Default to ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: "Move seat all the way back"  CUR

name: Seat Ventilation Switch Control
description: Turn on or off seat ventilation. The seat ventilation function can blow air for heat dissipation on seats (seat cushion and backrest), primarily applicable to seat overheating scenarios.
usage: Open current seat ventilation for cooling when users feel hot buttocks|buttocks heat|buttocks too hot|unbearable seat heat|sweaty back|moist back. Use this function to turn off seat ventilation when users adjust ventilation level too high, i.e. when [seat] ventilation is too strong.
extra_rag_text: seat overheating|seat feels hot|xxx seat overheating|xxx seat feels hot

action.description: Switch status including [on, off].

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Output must be a list. Output default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Sunroof Ventilation Control
description: Open or close the sunroof ventilation mode.
usage: Opening the sunroof ventilation mode will position the sunroof horizontally open to allow sufficient ventilation.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Leg Rest Height Adjustment
description: Adjust the height of seat leg rest. 1. Supports raising or lowering seat leg rest (by single point or specific gear positions). 2. Adjust seat leg rest height to specific percentage or gear position. 3. Supports adjusting seat leg rest to highest/lowest positions. This function satisfies users' requirements for leg rest height adjustment.

value.description: Adjustment value for seat leg rest height. Three representation formats:  Set to numeric value: unsigned n or n% (natural number) indicating adjustment to nth gear or n% position.  Relative adjustment: '+' for raise, '' for lower. '+n'/+n% indicates raise by n gears/n%, 'n'/n% indicates lower by n gears/n%, ranges [1, n] or [0%, 100%].  Preset positions: options [max, min] representing highest/lowest positions. Output default 'N/A' when value cannot be determined.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) for operation. Must output as list. Output default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Seat Direction Relative Adjustment
description: Adjusts the seat forward or backward (sliding) to meet user requirements for changing seat positions and resolve seating congestion issues.
usage: Determine whether the seat should move forward or backward based on user descriptions to fulfill requirements.  Move current seat backward when user feels (front) crowded or needs more legroom.  Move driver seat backward when user needs to stay away from steering wheel.  Move driver seat forward when user is too far from steering wheel.  Move driver seat backward when user is too close to steering wheel and needs distance.  Move corresponding positions backward when xx position is congested.  Move seat backward when it's too far forward.  Move seat forward when it's too far backward.  Move front seats forward when rear space is limited.

value.description: Determines seat movement direction based on user instructions. Available values: [front, back]. Use default value N/A when direction cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: When user mentions 'xx position congestion/legs can't extend', indicates need to move xx backward  back
'Help adjust passenger seat forward for rear space'  front

direction_range.description: Specific movement distance of seat. Represented as percentage (0%100%). Use default NULL when distance is unspecified.

position.description: Target seat positions. Must output as list. Use default ["CUR"] when positions cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: 'Driver seat congestion' indicates moving driver seat backward  driver
'Passenger legroom insufficient' indicates moving passenger seat backward  passenger
'Move front seats forward for rear storage'  front

name: Seat Direction Absolute Adjustment
description: Slide/move/adjust the seat forward or backward to a specified position.
usage: Expressions like 'adjust seat to middle'|'move seat toward middle'|'it's too crowded here, adjust backward to midpoint' indicate moving the seat to 50% position.

value.description: Specifies absolute position (1%99%) in forward/backward direction. Output default 'N/A' when unable to determine value.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) for operation, must output as list. Default to ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Trunk Opening Degree Inquiry
description: Query the opening degree (extent of opening) of the trunk.

name: Rearview Mirror Direction Adjustment
description: Adjust the direction of rearview mirrors (side mirrors). Supports upward, downward, leftward, and rightward adjustments.
usage: Users can adjust rearview mirror directions through this function to ensure clear visibility of rear and side conditions.  When users find rearview mirrors can only see lower areas (excessively low field of view), adjust mirrors upward. Example: 'The right rearview mirror can only see the lower area'  adjust the right rearview mirror upward. 'The leftside field of view feels somewhat low'  adjust the left rearview mirror upward.  When users find rearview mirror field of view is too high, adjust mirrors downward.

value.description: Adjustment directions for rearview mirrors including upward, downward, inward, and outward.

direction_range.description: Output 'max' when direction reaches extreme positions; 'mid' for middle positions. Output default value 'NULL' in other cases.

position.description: Control positions of rearview mirrors. Options: [NULL, left, right, all]. Output default 'NULL' when position cannot be determined or unspecified.

name: Seat Height Adjustment
description: Adjust the seat height. 1. Support relative value adjustment (raise/lower height). 2. Set seat height to specified position (numerical value or percentage). 3. Adjust seat height to highest/lowest position.
usage: Lower seat when head is about to touch sunroof/ceiling, e.g., 'head is about to touch sunroof', use this function to lower seat.  Raise seat when seat is too low or visibility is poor.  Lower seat height when visibility is too high.  'Adjust seat height to middle' indicates setting to 50% height.

value.description: Seat height adjustment value. Three representations:  Set to specific value: unsigned n (integer, percentage or fraction), i.e., adjust seat position to n.  Adjust height up/down: '+' for raise, '' for lower. '+n' means raise by n%, 'n' means lower by n%. Value range [1%, 100%].  Set to extremes: 'max' for highest, 'min' for lowest. Output default 'N/A' when adjustment value cannot be determined. E.g., '' for seat lowering. Output 'N/A' for copilot seat adjustments.
mapping_rules: seat raise a bit/seat too low +
seat feels low, adjust to middle 50%

position.description: Invehicle positions. Must output as list. Output default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Must not fabricate values.

name: Seat Leg Rest Angle Adjustment
description: Adjust the upright amplitude of seat leg rest, supporting specified amplitude values or unspecified values.
usage: Supported command patterns include: 'Adjust leg rest to straight position', 'Set leg rest to straight position', 'Set leg rest to 20% straight position'.

value.description: Specifies the adjustment amplitude for leg rest tilting.  Represented as percentage, value range [1%, 99%]. Output default value 'NULL' when user doesn't specify adjustment amplitude.

name: Seat Easy Entry Mode Adjustment
description: Adjust the seat easy entry/exit mode, including 'exit' and 'exit and entry' modes. Only supported for front passenger seat.
usage: 'Exit' mode automatically adjusts seat position only when the user exits the vehicle. 'Exit and Entry' mode automatically adjusts seat position both when the user enters and exits the vehicle.

value.description: Specify the mode for seat easy entry function. Options are [exit, exit and entry]. Output default value 'N/A' when the intended mode cannot be determined.

name: Rearview Mirror Switch Control
description: Open or close the rearview mirror (car ears, exterior mirrors). Expanded rearview mirror means opening, folded rearview mirror means closing.
usage: 'Open car ears' indicates 'open rearview mirror', ensuring the driver can check rear conditions; 'Close car ears' indicates 'close rearview mirror', reducing vehicle width to avoid collisions and protect the mirror.  'Car ears are opened'|'Car ears opened'|'Open car ears' all indicate opening the rearview mirror.  'Close car ears'|'Turn off car ears' all indicate closing the rearview mirror.  Close rearview mirror when users feel its reflection is dazzling.  Close rearview mirror when users think current situation might collide with it. Example: 'This position seems about to hit the rearview mirror'.

object_raw.description: Selection based on user input, options include rearview mirror, reversing mirror.

action.description: Switch status including [open, close]. 'open' indicates opening rearview mirror, 'close' indicates closing rearview mirror.
mapping_rules: 'Do not fold rearview mirror anymore'  open

position.description: Control rearview mirror position, options [NULL, left, right, all]. Output default 'NULL' when position cannot be determined or unspecified.

name: Seat Lumbar Support Direction Adjustment
description: Adjust the direction of seat lumbar support, including forward, backward, upward, downward, and mid. This function can meet users' needs for adjusting lumbar support positions.
usage: Lumbar support refers to the protruding part of the backrest. Lumbar support upward adjustment = raising lumbar support height; lumbar support downward adjustment = lowering lumbar support height.  When the back isn't resting against the lumbar support, move the lumbar support forward.  When the lumbar support is pushing against the back, move the lumbar support backward.  When the lumbar support is too high, move it downward to alleviate excessive height.

value.description: Adjustment direction of lumbar support with optional values [NULL, forward, backward, mid, upward, downward]. Output 'mid' when adjusting to middle position.
mapping_rules: back not resting against lumbar support forward
lumbar support position too high downward

direction_range.description: Output 'max' when direction reaches maximum forward/backward position. Output default value 'NULL' in other cases.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Output must be a list. Output default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Rearview Mirror Auto Fold Control When Locking Vehicle
description: Enable or disable the automatic folding function for rearview mirrors (door mirrors, exterior mirrors) when locking the vehicle. This function is only applicable to vehicle locking scenarios.
usage: When locking the vehicle, the rearview mirrors will automatically fold (retract) to protect them, save space, and prevent accidental damage.  Enable this feature when parked to automatically fold rearview mirrors after locking the vehicle, avoiding potential collisions with the mirrors.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off. 'on' indicates automatically folding rearview mirrors when locking the vehicle (retracting them), while 'off' disables folding upon vehicle locking.

name: Seat Ventilation Level Adjustment
description: Adjust the intensity (level) of seat ventilation. 1. Supports increasing or decreasing seat ventilation level. 2. Set seat ventilation to specific numerical levels (natural numbers) or preset levels (high, mid, low). 3. Adjust seat ventilation to maximum or minimum level.
usage: Used in hot weather conditions when users need to adjust ventilation intensity.  Increase seat ventilation level indicates raising the ventilation level.  'Seat feels cold, lower ventilation level' indicates decreasing seat ventilation level.

value.description: Adjustment value for seat ventilation level. Three representations:  Set to specific numerical value using unsigned n (natural number), format: set ventilation to level n.  Increase/decrease levels using '+' for increase and '' for decrease. '+n' means increase n levels, 'n' means decrease n levels (positive integer in range [1, n]).  Set to preset levels [max, high, mid, low, min] representing maximum, high, medium, low, and minimum levels respectively. Output default 'N/A' when adjustment value cannot be determined.

position.description: Target position(s) in vehicle. Must output as list. Output default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Handsfree Tailgate Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's handsfree tailgate feature.
usage: After activating the handsfree tailgate feature, sensors will automatically detect corresponding gestures to open/close the trunk without requiring manual operation from the user.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Mode Switching
description: Switch seat massage modes, supporting unspecified mode, previous mode, next mode, and specified numbered modes (e.g. first massage mode, second massage mode).
usage: When users need to switch current massage mode, set seat massage to unspecified mode if no specific mode is preferred.

number.description: Target mode number for switching.  '1' indicates previous mode, '+1' indicates next mode.  Natural numbers represent nth mode.  Output default 'NULL' when users don't specify 'previous' or 'next' mode switching.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Must output as list. Use default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Window Opening Status Query
description: Query the opening degree (open level) of the window.

name: Keyless Unlock Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the vehicle's keyless unlock functionality.
usage: When keyless unlock is enabled, the vehicle will authenticate with the key fob when the owner approaches. After successful authentication, doors will automatically unlock when pressing the door handle switch or touching the handle's sensor area.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Outputs default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Adaptive Lumbar Support Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the adaptive mode of lumbar support.
usage: When enabled, the adaptive lumbar support automatically adjusts its position based on user's posture to ensure comfortable lumbar support.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Applicable invehicle positions, must be output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate information and must output default value ["CUR"].

name: Window Switch Status Query
description: Query the current status of car windows, including whether they are open and their opening degree.

name: TwoStep Unlock Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's twostep unlock function.
usage: This safety feature requires two actions: first press unlocks only the driver's door, second press unlocks other three doors and tailgate.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Massage Intensity Level Adjustment
description: Adjust the intensity level (gear position) of seat massage. 1. Supports increasing or decreasing seat massage intensity (by single/multiple levels). 2. Adjust seat massage to specific gear positions (natural numbers) or preset positions (high, mid, low, strong, comfort, gentle). 3. Adjust seat massage to maximum or minimum intensity level.
usage: When user feels massage is too strong, decrease intensity level.  When user feels massage is too light, increase intensity level.  'Make massage gentler' indicates need to set intensity level to low.  When user complains about back pain from massage, set intensity level to low.  'Set massage to middle' requires setting intensity level to mid.  'Massage maximum intensity' indicates adjusting massage to highest level.
extra_rag_text: Set seat massage intensity to low.  Increase massage intensity.  Adjust massage to middle level.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'NULL' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

value.description: Adjustment value for seat massage intensity level. Three representation formats:  Numeric gear position (unsigned natural number), e.g. set to nth gear.  Relative adjustment using '+' (increase) or '' (decrease) symbols. '+n' means increase n levels, 'n' means decrease n levels (integer range 1~n).  Preset positions: [max, high, mid, low, min, strong, comfort, gentle] corresponding to maximum, high, mid, low, minimum, strong, comfort, gentle levels respectively. Output default 'N/A' when adjustment value cannot be determined.

position.description: Target seat position(s) in vehicle. Must output as list. Use default ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: OneClick Find Item Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the oneclick find item functionality.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Tow Mode Switch Status Query
description: Query the on/off status of tow mode.

name: Steering Wheel Position Adjustment Settings Page
description: Open or close the setup page for steering wheel position adjustment.
usage: Opening the steering wheel position adjustment settings page allows users to manually adjust the steering wheel's position. Exiting the steering wheel position adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Fuel Cap Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's fuel cap.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sunshade Opening Level Query
description: Check the opening degree (opening level) of the sunshade.

name: Seat Backrest Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat backrest settings page.
usage: Open this page to allow users to view and manually adjust backrestrelated settings such as direction and angle. Open the backrest settings page when unable to locate specific seat backrest or seat support functions. Exiting backrest adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Memory Position Adjustment
description: Adjust or switch seat memory positions, supporting adjustment to absolute memory numbers (Position 1, Position 2, Position 3), relative memory numbers (previous position, next position), and unspecified memory numbers.
usage: Users can adjust seat memory positions through this function to meet different drivers' needs for quick seat adjustment to preset positions.  Setting seat memory to first position indicates adjusting to Position 1.  Switching current seat position indicates changing the seat's memory position.  Adjusting to user's previous sitting position indicates switching to the previous seat memory position.

memlocation.description: Seat memory position for selecting preset memory numbers, including absolute memory numbers (represented as positive integers) and relative memory numbers ('1' indicates previous position, '+1' indicates next position). Output default value 'NULL' when memory number cannot be determined.

name: Front Hood Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's front hood (front trunk).
usage: Open the front hood when users need to inspect the vehicle's front interior compartment or add windshield washer fluid. Open the front trunk when users need to store items in the front storage space. For example: 'Open the box at the front of the vehicle' indicates the need to open the front trunk.

action.description: Switch status including [open, close, pause]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as open/close/pause.

name: Zero Gravity Seat Switch Control
description: Open or close the zero gravity mode of the seat.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) affected. Must be output as a list. Output default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Seat Ventilation Duration Setting
description: Set the duration for seat ventilation. Allows configuration of specific minutes or continuous ventilation.

value.description: Ventilation duration. Two representation formats:  Specific time value in HH:MM:SS format.  Nonspecific time value. Valid options are [continuous]. Output default value 'N/A' when unable to determine specific time or continuous status.

position.description: Target invehicle positions. Must output as a list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate values and must output default value ["CUR"].

name: Seat Heating Level Adjustment
description: Adjust heating level (intensity) of seats, i.e., regulate seat temperature. 1. Support increasing or decreasing seat heating level (slightly). 2. Set seat heating to specific levels (natural numbers) or preset levels (high, mid, low). 3. Adjust seat heating to maximum/minimum level.
usage: Note: Seat heating is not equivalent to cabin heating.  In cold weather, users may increase seat heating level.  When seat temperature feels excessively high, lower heating level to avoid excessive seat temperature.  When seat temperature is extremely low, setting heating to maximum level can quickly warm up seats for passenger comfort.

value.description: Adjustment value for seat heating level. Three representation formats:  Set to specific numerical levels (natural numbers), format: unsigned n (natural number) meaning setting to nth level.  Increase/decrease levels using '+' (increase) and '' (decrease). '+n' means increase n levels, 'n' means decrease n levels (integer range [1, n]).  Preset levels: [max, high, mid, low, min] representing maximum, high, medium, low, minimum levels respectively. Output default value 'N/A' when heating level adjustment value cannot be determined.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) to apply adjustment. Must output as list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do NOT generate random values.

name: Exterior VoiceActivated Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the exterior voiceactivated light.
usage: After arriving at a parking lot during nighttime, users can activate the exterior voiceactivated light via voice command to facilitate vehicle location.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sunroof Sunshade Settings Page Control
description: Open or close the settings page for the sunroof sunshade.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Front Combination Light Mode Switching
description: Switch the mode of the front combination light, supporting switching to auto light mode (auto), low beam mode, or position light mode.

name: Breathing/Heartbeat Ambient Light Speed Switching
description: Switch the speed of breathing ambient light or heartbeat ambient light. Speed levels include slow, medium, and fast.

value.description: Interval speed levels including short, medium, long. Short interval represents fast speed, long interval represents slow speed.

name: Trunk SkyGround Door Switch Control
description: Control the opening, closing, and pausing operations of the trunk's sky door or ground door.
usage: 'Skyground door' is a type of trunk opening mechanism. The 'skyground door' trunk enables twostage opening  upper section opening upwards and lower section opening downwards, implementing a dualstage trunk opening. Opening sky door = open upper half of trunk door, opening ground door = open lower half of trunk door.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off, pause]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off/pause.
mapping_rules: Pause the upper trunk door at current height pause

name: Auto High Beam Control Switch
description: Turn on or off the automatic mode for high beam lights, i.e., auto high beam functionality.
usage: Indicates turning off high beam auto mode when automatic adjustment is not required.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Ceiling Screen Collision Prevention Alert
description: Enable or disable collision prevention alert function for ceiling screens (rear screen, secondrow screen, TV screen, entertainment screen).
usage: When the vehicle is in motion, users may enable the collision prevention alert function for rear screens to enhance driving safety and avoid collisions between rear screens and passengers.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: HUD Settings Page
description: Open or close the HUD settings page. Supports access to more specific secondary pages (brightness, angle, height settings pages).
usage: The HUD projects key information (e.g. vehicle speed, navigation prompts, warnings) directly onto the windshield (projection in front of the driver, projection before the windshield), serving as the main virtual display in front of the driver. Opening the HUD settings page allows users to configure and adjust the headsup display in detail.  This page supports manual adjustment of HUD brightness, angle, orientation, and height.  Exiting HUD adjustment indicates closing the HUD settings page.  Open this primary settings page when users ask how to adjust the numbers and icons displayed on the HUD.

part_raw.description: Subpages of HUD settings including [NULL, brightness, angle, height], representing HUD main settings page, HUD brightness settings page, HUD angle settings page, and HUD height settings page respectively. Output default value 'NULL' when user doesn't specify a particular secondary settings page.

part.description: Subpages of HUD settings including [NULL, brightness, angle, height], representing HUD main settings page, HUD brightness settings page, HUD angle settings page, and HUD height settings page respectively. Output default value 'NULL' when user doesn't specify a particular secondary settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: OneClick Stealth Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the oneclick stealth function for interior lights.
usage: Used when users require privacy protection or need to quickly avoid external interference, such as during nighttime parking or temporary stops in public areas. The oneclick stealth function can immediately turn off all interior lights to prevent external visibility, enabling rapid concealment of invehicle conditions.

name: Seat Legrest Direction Adjustment
description: Adjust the direction of seat legrest, including forward, backward, mid, up, and down, supporting adjustment to limit positions (frontmost, rearmost, uppermost, lowermost). This function satisfies users' needs for legrest position adjustment.
usage: 'Move forward a bit' indicates adjusting the legrest forward.  'Legs are suspended, adjust the legrest' indicates adjusting the legrest upward slightly.  When users want to level/flatten the leg position, it means adjusting the legrest to the frontmost position.  'Legrest at maximum height' indicates adjusting the legrest to the lowermost position.

value.description: Adjustment direction of legrest, optional values [N/A, front, rear, mid, up, down]. 'mid' indicates mid position. Output 'N/A' when direction cannot be determined.

direction_range.description: Specifies legrest adjustment range. Three representations:  Percentage value [0%, 100%]  'max' when adjusting to frontmost/rearmost/uppermost/lowermost  'NULL' when no specific value specified (e.g. 'adjust up a bit')

position.description: Target seat positions. Must output as list. Default to ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined.

name: Tow Mode Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's tow mode.
usage: When users need to tow a vehicle or be towed, they can activate tow mode through this function.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Overhead Screen AutoClose on Lock Control
description: Control whether overhead screens (rear screen, secondrow screen, TV screen, entertainment screen) automatically close when the vehicle is locked.
usage: Enable this feature to have overhead screens automatically close after vehicle locking to conserve power.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Ambient Light Settings Page
description: Open or close the ambient light settings page.
usage: Open this page to allow users to view or personalize and manually adjust invehicle ambient light settings based on personal preferences. Closing the ambient light adjustment interface indicates exiting this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Seat Shoulder Direction Adjustment
description: Adjust the direction of seat shoulder support, including forward and backward. This functionality fulfills users' needs for adjusting shoulder position.
usage: Move the seat shoulder forward when users feel their shoulders aren't properly supported. Move the shoulder support forward when users feel their shoulders are leaning too far back.

value.description: Adjustment direction, valid values: forward, backward.

direction_range.description: Output 'max' when direction is at extreme forward/rear position; 'mid' when at middle position. Output default value 'NULL' otherwise.

position.description: Target invehicle position(s). Must output as array. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"] without speculation.

name: Seat Heating Switch Status Query
description: Query the on/off status of seat heating.

name: Door Opening Cabin Lighting Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the door opening cabin lighting feature.
usage: When the door opening cabin lighting feature is enabled, it will automatically illuminate the cabin interior space when the user opens the car door.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Privacy Lock Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's privacy lock.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off].

name: Ambient Light Color Settings Page
description: Open or close the ambient light color settings page.
usage: Open this page to allow users to manually modify settings related to ambient light color. Exiting the ambient light color settings interface indicates closing this page.
extra_rag_text: Flashing lights refer to ambient lighting. The colored illumination in the vehicle cabin indicates ambient lights.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Window Ventilation Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the window ventilation mode. The window ventilation mode aims to improve incabin air quality by promoting air exchange between the vehicle interior and exterior.
usage: Activate this feature when detecting commands containing: ventilation|airflow|seat ventilation|smoking mode. Note: Window ≠ sunroof. When unspecified whether sunroof or window ventilation is requested, default to activating this feature.  User expressions like 'I want ventilation', 'Turn on airflow', or 'There's stuffiness in the car' indicate need to activate window ventilation.  Activate this ventilation function when users request to smoke.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Affected invehicle positions, must output as list. Return default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Never generate undefined values.

name: Seat Cushion Settings Page
description: Open or close the seat cushion settings page.
usage: Opening the cushion settings page allows users to view and manually adjust the cushion tilt angle. Exiting cushion adjustment indicates closing the settings page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Parking Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the parking lights.
usage: Enable parking lights when vehicle is parked roadside or in parking lots to mark vehicle position and improve visibility.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Automatic Courtesy Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the automatic courtesy light inside the vehicle.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Ceiling Screen Angle Adjustment
description: Adjust the angle of ceiling screens (rear screen, secondrow screen, TV screen, entertainment screen). Supports increasing/decreasing the angle or adjusting to maximum/minimum values.

value.description: Angle adjustment value. Two representation formats:  Increase/decrease angle: '+' for increase, '' for decrease.  Adjust to max/min: options [max, min]. Output default value 'N/A' when angle value cannot be determined.

name: Ceiling Screen Direction Adjustment
description: Move the screen with directions (movement angles) including inward, outward, forward, backward, supporting adjustment to extreme positions (maximum forward, maximum backward, maximum outward, maximum inward).
usage: Applicable for ceiling screens (rear row screen, second row screen, TV screen, entertainment screen).  Moving the screen forward means using this function to move the screen frontward.
extra_rag_text: When the roof screen is too far from me, it indicates the need to move the ceiling screen backward.

value.description: When users need to bring the screen closer, move it backward; when needing to move the screen away, move it forward. Forward (outward) movement increases the screen's angle with the roof, backward (inward) movement reduces it.
mapping_rules: 'Adjust ceiling screen angle outward a bit' > outer
'Adjust ceiling screen angle inward a bit' > inner

direction_range.description: Output 'max' when adjusting to extreme forward/backward positions, otherwise output default value 'NULL'.

name: Nap Mode Switch Control
description: Open or close nap mode (rest space, relaxation space).
usage: Nap mode, also known as sleep mode, facilitates user rest. Triggers for activation include: Onebutton recline|I want to rest for a while|Take a nap|I'm sleepy|I want to sleep  all indicating user's desire to enter nap mode for better rest experience. Close this feature to restore seat positions when rest completes.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Target invehicle positions. Output must be a list. Use default value ["CUR"] when seat position cannot be determined. Do not make assumptions.

name: Sunroof Opening Adjustment
description: Adjust the opening/closing range of the sunroof. 1. Support setting sunroof opening range (gear position) to specific positions including crack opening (keywords: 'open to', 'close to', 'open a crack'). 2. Support increasing or decreasing sunroof opening range (e.g., open sunroof slightly, open sunroof wider). 3. Support setting sunroof opening range to maximum or minimum positions (e.g., fully open sunroof).

action.description: Opening wider (keywords: open wider, enlarge, down, lower, etc.)  output 'open'. Closing narrower (keywords: close smaller, rise, up, higher, etc.)  output 'close'.

value.description: Sunroof opening control value. Three formats:  Absolute position values using 'open to xxx'/'close to xxx'. Formats: 1) Unsigned n (integer, percentage or fraction). E.g., 'open sunroof to 20%'  '20%', 'close sunroof to 1/4'  '1/4'.  Relative adjustment values: '+' indicates closing narrower, '' indicates opening wider. E.g., 'close slightly'  '+', 'open a third'  '1/3'.  Extreme values: [max, min, minor]. E.g., 'fully open'  'max', 'open a crack'  'minor'.

position.description: Vehicle position identifiers. Must output as array. Use default ["CUR"] when position cannot be determined.

name: High Beam Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the high beam switch.
usage: Open high beam when users need enhanced illumination during night driving.  Illuminate high beam indicates turning on the high beam.  Close high beam when encountering oncoming vehicles or entering welllit areas to avoid distracting other drivers.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Ceiling Screen Settings Page
description: Open or close the settings page for ceiling screens (rear row screen, second row screen, TV screen, entertainment screen).
usage: Open this page to view and configure detailed settings or perform operations for ceiling screen functions. Exiting the ceiling screen adjustment interface indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Marker Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off marker lights (width lights). Supports switching to marker light mode.
usage: In low visibility conditions or at night, turning on marker lights can improve vehicle visibility and ensure driving safety.

name: Window Opening Range Adjustment
description: Adjust the opening range of windows (glass|door window|window). Supports:  Setting window opening range (gear position) to specific positions or a crack (keywords: 'open to', 'close to', 'open a crack').  Increasing/decreasing window opening range (e.g., window slightly open, window open wider, close window 30%, open window 10%, partially open window, crack open window).  Setting window opening range to maximum/minimum positions (e.g., fully open window, lower window completely). Related scenarios:  'Crack open window' indicates slightly closing it.  Close window further when lowered too much.  Open window wider when raised too high.  Window opened a crack.  Open window wider when odor is strong.

action.description: Opening wider actions: open wider/adjust larger/lower/shake down/lower position  output 'open'. Closing actions: close smaller/raise/adjust smaller/higher position  output 'close'.

value.description: Window opening control value. Three formats: 1) Absolute position (unsigned n): integer/percentage/fraction (follow user's expression). E.g., 'open window to 20%'  '20%', 'close window to 10'  '10', 'quarter open'  '50%'. 2) Relative adjustment: '+n' (close n units), 'n' (open n units). E.g., 'close halfway'  '+50%', 'open 2/3'  '2/3', 'close 80 units'  '+80'. Vague expressions like 'open slightly'  '', 'close a bit'  '+'. 3) Special values: [max, min, minor]. 'max'=fully open, 'min'=fully closed, 'minor'=crack open. Note: **Minimum position always uses 'min'**.

position.description: Effective positions in vehicle. Output must be list. Use default ["CUR"] when position unclear.

name: Sunshade Adjustment Control
description: Adjust the sunroof sunshade opening degree (percentage)/gear position. Moving the sunshade backward decreases coverage (opens wider), moving it forward increases coverage (closes smaller). Supports setting sunshade opening degree/position to specific values, increasing/decreasing opening degree, or setting to maximum/minimum positions. Also known as sunshade panel, sunroof shade, sunroof curtain, etc. This function allows drivers/passengers to adjust sunshade coverage according to personal preferences and environmental conditions, controlling sunshades located above windows or on vehicle roofs. By effectively blocking direct sunlight, it reduces heat accumulation in the cabin, decreases AC system load, while creating a more private and comfortable environment. Typical scenarios:  Close sunshade when users need sun protection

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Backward movement=open wider=output 'on'. Forward movement=close smaller=output 'off'.

value.description: Sunshade position control value. Three formats: 1) Absolute position values expressed as unsigned n (percentage/fraction), e.g. '20%' or '1/4'. Minor opening expressed as 'minor'. 2) Relative adjustment values: '+n' (close smaller by n), 'n' (open wider by n). n must be percentage/fraction values. 3) Extreme values [max, min] for fully open/closed positions.
