When adjusting brightness: use [+/], [+/percentage] or [+/integer], where '+' indicates increase and '' indicates decrease.  When setting extreme values: use [max, min]. Output default value 'N/A' when brightness value cannot be determined.

name: Sunroof Switch Control
description: Open or close the sunroof. This function will fully open or completely close the sunroof.
usage: When the sunroof is tilted open, it indicates opening the sunroof.  Descriptions like 'Continue opening sunroof' without degree values all indicate opening the sunroof.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: The vehicle position affected, output must be a list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate values and must output default ["CUR"].

name: Button Backlight Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the button backlight.
usage: Turning on the button backlight allows better identification of invehicle buttons during night driving or in lowlight environments, enhancing operational safety and convenience.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when the action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sunshade Switch Status Query
description: Check the switch status of the sunshade.

name: Immediate Charging Switch Control
description: Open or close the immediate charging function. Opening this switch will immediately start charging; closing it will stop charging. For example, 'Don't charge now' indicates closing this function.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when the action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: External Light Mode Switching
description: Switch external light/headlight modes, supporting switching to auto light mode (auto), low beam mode, or position light mode.

light_type_outside.description: Light type (transformed object), front headlight = headlight.

name: Screen Theme Setting
description: Set the theme (display mode|vehicle display theme) for the vehicle system screen (display). The display theme is userspecified, including three modes: daytime, nighttime, and auto.
usage: Change theme according to user requirements. For example, 'When the interior light is too bright, change the theme to daytime mode' indicates setting the screen theme to daytime mode.

mode.description: Different themes for the screen. 'sunrise' represents daytime mode, 'sunset' represents nighttime mode, 'auto' indicates automatic theme switching based on time. Output default value 'NULL' when theme mode cannot be determined.

name: Valley Charging Time Settings
description: Set the start time or end time for valley charging. Configuring valley charging time allows electric vehicle charging during periods with lower electricity demand and relatively cheaper electricity rates, helping to reduce costs.

part.description: Time label for valley charging configuration. Options: [Start time, End time]. Default to Start time when label type is unspecified. Example: When user mentions 'valley charging starting from 22:00', output 'Start time'.

value.description: Specific time for valley charging in 'HH:mm:ss' format using 24hour clock.

name: Button Backlight Brightness Adjustment
description: Adjust the backlight brightness of invehicle buttons (button lights). 1. Supports setting button backlight brightness to specific brightness values (percentage). 2. Supports brightening or dimming button backlight (e.g. dim a bit, brighten some, adjust by 10%). 3. Supports setting button backlight brightness to maximum or minimum level.

value.description: Button backlight brightness adjustment value with three representation formats:  When setting specific brightness, use step value (integer) with range 1n.  When increasing/decreasing brightness, use [+/integer] format with range [1, n], '+' indicates brightness increase, '' indicates decrease.  When setting extreme brightness, optional values are [max, min], where 'max' indicates maximum brightness and 'min' indicates minimum. Output default value 'N/A' when brightness adjustment value cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: 'This button light is a bit dark'  +

name: Screen Protection Toggle Control
description: Enable or disable the screen protection functionality.
usage: Screen protection safeguards the display, prevents burnin, and enables energy saving during user inactivity. Open this function when users want to configure screen protection settings. Example: 'Can the vehicle's screen set up screen protection? Help me enable it.'

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Screen Brightness Settings Page
description: Open or close the incar screen brightness settings page.
usage: Opening the screen brightness settings page allows users to manually adjust related configurations based on personal preferences. For example, 'Where is the screen brightness set?' should trigger opening this page. Exiting screen brightness adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Valley Charging Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the valley charging function. When enabled, charging will start during the configured valley period and automatically power off when the valley period ends.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: DVR Settings Page Control
description: Open or close the Driving Video Recorder (DVR) settings page.
usage: Open this page to allow users manually adjust DVR settings according to their preferences. This page includes photography settings, video recording settings, audio recording settings, emergency video settings, etc. Exiting DVR adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Whole Vehicle Backlight Brightness Adjustment
description: Adjust the brightness of the whole vehicle backlight. 1. Support setting the backlight brightness to specific percentage values. 2. Support increasing or decreasing backlight brightness (e.g. dim a bit, brighten some, adjust 10%). 3. Support setting backlight brightness to maximum or minimum level.

value.description: Backlight brightness adjustment value with three representation formats:  When setting specific brightness, use percentage values (1n).  When increasing/decreasing brightness, use [+/integer] format (range 1n), '+' for increase, '' for decrease.  For extreme values, optional [max, min] where 'max' indicates maximum brightness and 'min' indicates minimum. Output default value 'N/A' when brightness value cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: This backlight is a bit dark  +

name: Ambient Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the incabin ambient lights.
usage: Turn on ambient lights to enhance the incabin atmosphere. When no specific ambient light type is specified for turning off, use this function to turn off all ambient lights.
extra_rag_text: Flickering lights refer to ambient lights. Colored illuminating lights in the vehicle indicate ambient lights.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: The applicable incabin position(s) must be output as an array. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate values  must output default ["CUR"].

name: Wiper Settings Page
description: Open the wiper settings page. The 'wiper settings page' allows drivers to flexibly configure and adjust wiper operating modes, sensitivity levels, and cleaning functionality based on weather conditions, driving speed, and personal driving habits.

name: Reverse Wiper Linkage
description: Enable or disable reverse wiper linkage. When activated, links the front wiper or rear wiper operation in reverse mode.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Wiper position with options [front, rear]. Output 'front' when user specifies front wiper linkage, and 'rear' for rear wiper linkage.

name: Screen Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the vehicle screen display, i.e., activate or deactivate the invehicle screen.
usage: The invehicle screens include the main screen in the front row and the overhead screens in the rear row (rear screen, secondrow screen, TV screen, entertainment screen). The overhead screen refers to the vehicle's ceilingmounted display or roof screen, installed at the top interior of the vehicle (typically at the center of the roof or near the front passenger headrest). The most common use for overhead screens is providing entertainment options for rear passengers, especially during long journeys, as they can play movies, TV shows, games, and other multimedia content to help pass time and enhance the riding experience.  Foldable overhead screen indicates closing the overhead screen (rear screen, secondrow screen, TV screen, entertainment screen).

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Vehicle interior location. Must output default value 'NULL' when controlled screen position cannot be determined.
mapping_rules: overhead screen=TV screen=rear screen=entertainment screen rear

name: Double Flash Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the double flash light (hazard lights).
usage: The double flash light can alert other vehicles or pedestrians.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Scheduled Departure Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the scheduled departure switch. Note this switch only controls whether the feature is enabled.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Scheduled Charging Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the scheduled charging feature. When enabled, scheduled charging allows users to charge within specified time periods until full capacity is reached. Note that this function only controls the enablement of scheduled charging and cannot configure specific charging parameters.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Gear Position Lamp Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the gear position lamp. This function allows users to activate or deactivate the gear position lamp for better visibility of the gear shift position in lowlight conditions, enhancing driving safety.
usage: Users can utilize this function to turn on/off the gear position lamp, enabling clearer visibility of the gear shift position at night or in dimly lit environments, thereby improving driving safety.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off].

name: Wiper Switch Control
description: Open or close the windshield wiper (wiper blade).
usage: Activating wiper or wiper blade water spray indicates turning on the wiper.
extra_rag_text: No wiper needed indicates turning off the wiper.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Controlled wiper position. Wipers typically include front and rear wipers. Output 'NULL' when specific wiper is not specified.

name: Wiper Speed Adjustment
description: Control the speed of wiper (windshield wiper) blade movement. Increasing wiper speed decreases wiping interval, while decreasing wiper speed increases wiping interval.

value.description: Speed of wiper blade movement indicated by [+, ]. '+' represents increasing wiper speed (shortening wiping interval), '' represents decreasing wiper speed (lengthening wiping interval). Example: 'The heavier the rain, the higher the wiper speed' would output '+'

name: Invehicle Discharge Type Configuration
description: Configure the discharge type for invehicle power supply, including vehicletovehicle (V2V) charging and vehicletoload (V2L) charging. This setting enables the vehicle to supply power to different external devices. Example: When asking "How to use vehicle discharge to charge an electric scooter? Open it", this indicates setting the discharge type to V2V charging.

function.description: Output external charging type, options: [V2V charging, V2L charging].

name: Remaining Charging Time Query
description: Used to query remaining charging time, allowing users to check how much longer is needed to achieve full charge using this function.

name: Daytime Running Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the daytime running lights.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Wiper Sensitivity Adjustment
description: Adjust wiper sensitivity. 1. Support adjusting sensitivity upward/downward using relative values. 2. Support setting wiper sensitivity to specified levels. 3. Support setting to maximum/minimum sensitivity levels.
usage: Wiper sensitivity function: When rain sensors detect water droplets on the windshield, determine whether to activate wipers based on current sensitivity settings. Higher sensitivity makes wipers respond more quickly to small droplets, while lower sensitivity requires heavier rainfall to trigger operation. Note: 'wiper xx level' indicates adjusting wiper sensitivity level.

value.description: Wiper sensitivity adjustment values with three formats:  Specific level: integer values 110.  Relative adjustment: [+/integer] format with range [1, n], '+' increases sensitivity, '' decreases.  Extreme values: [max, min], 'max' for highest, 'min' for lowest. E.g. 'min' indicates setting to minimum level.

name: Scheduled Charging Frequency Setting
description: Configure the frequency and count (single or recurring) for scheduled charging. According to the configured scheduled charging frequency, the vehicle will automatically start charging at scheduled intervals. When users need to schedule a single charging session, set the frequency to single; when users want automatic daily charging, set the frequency to recurring. Example: 'Help me schedule a charging session once' indicates setting charging frequency to single.

value.description: Options for scheduled charging frequency. Including [single, cycle].

name: Fragrance Remaining Quantity Query
description: Check remaining fragrance cartridge capacity (service life).

name: Night Light Switch Control
description: Open or close the night light in the vehicle interior.
usage:
The night light is located at the bottom of the driver and front passenger seats.
 Turn on/off the footwell light (i.e., open/close the night light).

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Welcome Light Carpet Switch Control
description: Open or close the welcome light carpet.
usage: When the vehicle is unlocked or doors are opened, the welcome light carpet projects specific light patterns on the ground. Typically extending outward from the bottom of doors, it illuminates the surrounding area to prevent stepping on uneven surfaces or empty spaces.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: InVehicle Discharge Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the invehicle discharge function. Supports load discharge and vehicle discharge. The invehicle discharge function can output electrical energy from the battery to external devices, serving as an emergency power source.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Scheduled Departure Time Setting
description: Set the scheduled departure time. When the time is set, the vehicle can prepare in advance to ensure users enjoy a comfortable environment immediately upon entering, eliminating wait time for vehicle heating or cooling, saving time. Related scenarios:  Users can use this function to set scheduled departure time when planning to use the vehicle at a specific time point on the same day. Example: 'Help me set tonight's 10 o'clock departure'.

value.description: Specified departure time in 'HH:mm:ss' format (24hour clock). Example: 'Schedule departure time for 1:00 PM' outputs '13:00:00'.

name: RainSensing Wiper Switch Control
description: Open or close the rainsensing wiper. This function is only used when the user mentions the rainsensing wiper. Note: The rainsensing wiper is not the automatic wiper.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Controlled wiper position. Options are [front, rear, NULL]. Output 'NULL' when controlled wiper position is not specified.

name: Power Supply Integrated Mileage Protection Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the Power Supply Integrated Mileage Protection function. When enabled, the vehicle will stop discharging after reaching the specified mileage during operation.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Target Charge Level Adjustment
description: Adjust the vehicle's target charge level. The target charge level of the vehicle, also referred to as charge limit or charge upper limit.

value.description: Adjustment value for target charge level, with three representation formats:  When setting specified charge level, use percentage with numerical range 1%99%.  When setting relative charge level, use [+/ percentage] format with numerical range 1%99%, where '+' indicates increasing charge level and '' indicates decreasing.  When setting limit charge level, optional values are [max, min], where 'max' represents setting to maximum and 'min' represents setting to minimum.

name: Camping Mode Switch Control
description: Turn on or off Camping Mode (camping scenario, camping space).
usage: Users can activate Camping Mode to quickly transform the vehicle interior into a space suitable for camping.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Scheduled Departure Settings Page
description: Open or close the scheduled departure settings page. Opening this page allows users to manually configure future travel plans according to personal needs, such as preheating/precooling vehicles, scheduled charging, etc.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Driving Power Conservation Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's (highvoltage battery) driving power conservation or forced power conservation mode. Activating the power conservation function will automatically reserve a certain amount of battery charge for the user to prevent sudden power loss during driving.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Camera Switching
description: Switch between photo/video capture cameras.

name: Battery Preheating Mode Settings
description: Configure battery preheating modes including Sport and ECO. Preheats the battery to different temperatures to adapt to various driving modes.

mode.description: Battery preheating mode with options [ECO, Sport].

name: Desktop Preference Switching
description: Switch the display mode of the vehicle screen desktop, including Live Desktop, Map/Navigation Desktop, and Wallpaper Desktop.
usage: Users can use this function to switch between different screen display modes. For example, switch the desktop to Map while driving, and replace the desktop with Wallpaper when parked.

mode.description: Target mode for desktop preference switching.

name: Scheduled Charging Time Settings
description: Set the start or end time for scheduled charging. For example, 'xx' indicates the charging end time is xx:00. 'Does the vehicle have scheduled charging? Set it to 10 PM' means configuring scheduled charging time to 22:00. Note time format conversion should use 24hour clock system.

part.description: Time label for scheduled charging configuration. Options: [start time, end time]. 'start time' indicates scheduled charging activation time, 'end time' indicates charging termination time. Example: '8' outputs 'start time'. Defaults to 'start time' when unspecified.

value.description: Timestamp for scheduled charging in 24hour format 'HH:mm:ss'. Example: 'Set charging to stop at 6 PM' corresponds to timestamp '18:00:00'.

name: Fog Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the fog lights.
usage: Open corresponding fog lights when visibility is low in foggy or rainy conditions to improve front or rear visibility.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Fog light position. Output 'NULL' when front or rear fog light is not specified.

name: Welcome Light Settings Page
description: Open or close the welcome light settings page.
usage: Welcome lights activate when doors are opened, upon entering the vehicle, or as a welcoming gesture. Opening this page allows users to adjust welcome light settings according to personal preferences. Exiting welcome light adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Fragrance Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the incar fragrance system. The system can release fragrances to mask odors, refresh the mind, and regulate mood.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Battery Preheat Switch Control
description: Enable or disable battery preheat for scheduled departure. In lowtemperature environments, battery performance decreases. Through the scheduled departure function, users can preheat the battery before departure to improve its operational efficiency and range performance.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Charging Indicator Light Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the charging indicator light, which serves as the visual cue during charging. The activated indicator light will display colorcoded information reflecting current charging status.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Button Backlight Brightness Settings Page
description: Open or close the settings page for invehicle buttons' (button lights) backlight brightness.
usage: Open this page to allow users to view or adjust button backlight brightness settings. Exiting button adjustment indicates closing this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Vehicle Charging Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the vehicle charging function. Vehicle charging indicates charging the vehicle, i.e., providing power to the vehicle.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Target Discharge Level Adjustment
description: Set the target discharge level for the vehicle.

value.description: Target discharge level value with two representation formats:  Unsigned n indicating absolute setting. For example, '20%' means setting target discharge level to 20%.  +n/n indicating relative adjustment. For example, '+10%' increases target discharge level by 10%, '5%' decreases by 5%. When users mention 'increase slightly' or 'decrease slightly', output '+' for increases or '' for decreases.

name: DVR Switch Control
description: Open or close the Driving Video Recorder (DVR), configure DVR to invoke specific functions [take photo, video recording, emergency recording, audio recording].
usage: Open DVR when users need to record driving incidents or capture road conditions outside the vehicle.  Activate DVR's video recording function when users require video capture during driving.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

cammode.description: Operation mode for DVR. Options: [photo, video, emergency, audio, NULL]. Output default value 'NULL' when mode cannot be determined.

name: Recording Mute
description: Mute during recording, i.e., turn off audio during video capture. This feature helps users disable sound recording and reduce audio interference.

name: Wiper Mode Switch Control
description: Turn on or off specific wiper modes, supporting automatic wiper mode and maintenance mode. Maintenance mode will stand the wiper blades upright to facilitate maintenance.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Controlled wiper position with options [front, rear, NULL]. Output 'NULL' when the controlled wiper position is not specified.

name: Tire Temperature Query
description: Detect or query current tire temperature for users.

name: Smart Call Do Not Disturb
description: Enable or disable the Smart Call Do Not Disturb feature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Tire Pressure Query
description: Detect and query current overall tire pressure or tire pressure at specific positions for users.

position.description: Specific position for tire pressure query. Output default value 'NULL' when wheel position is not specified or querying all vehicle tire pressures.

name: Suspension Damping Settings
description: Used to set the suspension damping level of the vehicle, including three levels: High (Strong/Hard), Mid, Low (Soft). Users can adjust suspension damping through this function to adapt to different road conditions or driving preferences, such as choosing low damping for comfort or high damping to enhance handling performance.

value.description: Damping level setting

name: Tire Status Query
description: Detects/queries the current tire status for users.

name: Driving Power Maintenance Mode Switching
description: Switch the vehicle's power maintenance mode, including Intelligent Power Maintenance and Forced Power Maintenance.

name: Door Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle door.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Suspension Height Setting
description: Adjust the vehicle suspension height to normal or standard level.

name: Camera Focus Mode Position Control
description: Enable or disable the focus mode for a specific camera position, including leftside focus and rightside focus.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Fragrance Settings Page
description: Open or close the fragrance settings page. Opening the fragrance settings page allows users to view and modify fragrancerelated settings according to personal preferences.

name: Suspension Settings Page
description: Open or close the vehicle suspension settings page. This functionality allows users to access the suspension settings page when adjustments to vehicle suspension configurations are required.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Video Control Gesture
description: Enable or disable the video control gesture functionality.

action.description: Switch status including [enable, disable]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as enable/disable.

name: Power Supply Comprehensive Range Protection Settings
description: Set the range protection value for power supply integration, i.e., the maximum drivable range. For travel scenarios, set appropriate range protection values (unit: KM) within [150, 300]. When vehicle range reaches the set value, the system will stop discharging to prevent complete battery depletion and enhance safety.

value.description: Range protection value in KM, output in the format [positive integer + KM], value range [150, 300]. Example: 'Set Power Supply Comprehensive Range Protection to 200KM' should output '200KM'.

name: Scheduled Travel Date Setting
description: Set dates for scheduled travel (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday). Helps users schedule vehicle usage for specified dates. The vehicle will prepare in advance prior to the scheduled date. Related scenarios:  Users with fixed travel schedules can use this feature to set up scheduled trips.  Assist users in scheduling trips for specific weekdays (e.g. Monday, Tuesday).

value.description: Specified travel dates with options: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday.

name: Fragrance Switching
description: Switch current fragrance, supporting unspecified target fragrance, previous fragrance, next fragrance, and nth fragrance.
usage: When users feel the fragrance is too cloying and want to switch without specifying a particular number, should switch to the next fragrance.

action.description: Operation status including [on, off, switch]. Output default value 'NULL' when action cannot be determined as on/off/switch.

value.description: Target fragrance number for switching. '1' indicates previous fragrance, '+1' indicates next fragrance, n (positive integer) indicates nth fragrance. Output 'NULL' when user doesn't specify 'previous', 'next' or particular fragrance number.

name: Suspension Cargo Ease Mode Switch Control
description: Enable or disable Suspension Cargo Ease Mode. When activated, this feature automatically adjusts suspension height based on cargo weight to facilitate cargo handling. Relevant scenarios:  User needs to load/unload items: Activate Cargo Ease Mode to lower suspension chassis height.  After loading/unloading items: Deactivate Cargo Ease Mode.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Battery Temperature Control Switch Control
description: Open or close the battery temperature control function. When enabled, this function maintains the battery's temperature to prevent excessively low temperatures during cold winter conditions.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Small Window Mode Control
description: Open or close the small window mode of the vehicle system. Used to switch screen display modes during driving according to user needs, enabling or disabling the small window mode to meet information viewing requirements in different driving scenarios.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Antiglare Mode Control
description: Enable or disable the antiglare mode.

action.description: Switch status including on, off.

name: Fragrance Intensity Level Adjustment
description: Adjust fragrance intensity levels. 1. Support increasing or decreasing intensity (by points or percentages). 2. Support setting to specific intensity levels (numerical values or percentages where higher values indicate stronger fragrance) or predefined levels [low, medium, high, intense, light_elegancy]. 3. Support setting to maximum/minimum intensity.
usage: Decrease fragrance intensity when users feel the scent is too strong. Increase fragrance intensity when users feel the scent is too weak or faint. Switch to intense/light_elegancy mode by setting corresponding intensity levels.

value.description: Fragrance intensity adjustment value. Three representation formats:  For absolute values: Use [level values (110)] or [absolute percentages (0%100%)].  For relative adjustments: Use [+/ integers] or [+/ percentages]. '+' indicates increasing intensity, '' indicates decreasing.  For predefined levels: Options [max, high, mid, low, min, light_elegancy, rich_intensity] corresponding to maximum/high/medium/low/minimum intensity levels. Output default value 'N/A' when intensity adjustment cannot be determined.

name: Headrest Screen Brightness Adjustment
description: Adjust the brightness of headrest screens. 1. Support setting headrest screen brightness to specific percentage values (1%99%). 2. Support increasing or decreasing screen brightness (e.g. darken a bit, brighten some, adjust 10%). 3. Support setting headrest screen brightness to maximum or minimum levels.

value.description: Brightness adjustment value with three formats:  Absolute percentage (1%99%) when setting specific brightness  Percentage delta [+/− percentage] for brightness adjustment (1%99%), '+' for increase, '' for decrease  Extreme values [max, min] for maximum/minimum brightness. Output default 'N/A' when value cannot be determined.

position.description: Target seat positions (must output as list). Output default ["CUR"] when position cannot be determined.

name: Specified View Photography
description: Use camera to take photos from specific views including left, right, front, and rear. This function activates designated camera(s) in specified positions for photography when users want to capture images from particular angles.

position.description: Photography position options: front, rear, left, right.

name: Parking Power Generation Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the vehicle's parking power generation function. This function is used when the vehicle is parked.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Vehicle Search Mode Control
description: Set vehicle search mode to flashing lights or honk and flashing lights. The vehicle search mode (also known as vehicle positioning or carfinder function) helps owners quickly locate their vehicle in large parking lots or other complex environments.

value.description: Specific vehicle search mode options: [flashing lights, honk and flashing lights].

name: Suspension Switch Control

Suspension modes include sport suspension mode, comfort suspension mode, and maintenance suspension mode. Related scenarios:  Activate maintenance mode to adjust suspension for system maintenance, facilitating technicians' inspection and repair.  Switch to comfort suspension mode for enhanced driving comfort.  Switch to sport suspension mode for improved performance experience.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

mode.description: Suspension modes: maintenance mode, sport mode, comfort mode. Sport mode suits rugged roads, comfort mode suits flat roads. Output 'NULL' when mode is unspecified.

name: Camera Switch Control
description: Open or close the builtin camera in the vehicle. Note: This function cannot perform photographing or video recording, only awakens or closes the camera application.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Panoramic Imaging Mode Switching
description: Switch between 2D and 3D modes for Around View Monitor (AVM). Around View Monitor also known as 360 imaging, can display surrounding vehicle images on the incar screen. In 2D panoramic imaging mode (twodimensional view), the current imaging mode will switch to 2D view. In 3D panoramic imaging mode (threedimensional view), the current imaging mode will switch to 3D view.

value.description: Panoramic imaging mode options. Available values: [2D, 3D]

name: Electronic Parking Brake Switch Control
description: Activate or deactivate the electronic parking brake system.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Exterior Scenery Snapshot
description: Enable or disable the exterior scenery snapshot function.
usage: Enabling scenery snapshot allows users to capture beautiful roadside scenery without opening mobile camera apps, preserving wonderful moments. For example: assist users in photographing external scenery using this feature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off].
mapping_rules: 'The exterior scenery looks gorgeous, help me take a photo'  on

name: Lock Car Notification Sound Control
description: Control whether to emit a notification sound when locking the car. Allows users to choose if a beep prompt is needed during locking, suitable for quickly locating the vehicle in parking areas or confirming vehicle lock status.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Driver Door Unlock Switch Control
description: Enable or disable driver door unlockonly functionality. When enabled, only the driver door remains unlocked while other doors stay locked. Note: This feature is not a welcome function.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Child Hazardous Action Detection
description: Enable or disable the child hazardous action detection feature. This function utilizes incabin visual assistance to reduce the probability of children experiencing dangerous situations inside the vehicle.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: WiFi Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the vehicle's WiFi functionality. Enabling WiFi allows the vehicle to connect to the internet for online entertainment, navigation updates, or remote software upgrades.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Switch Bluetooth Call
description: Switch between devices in the vehicle's Bluetooth call list. Use this function when needing to switch from the currently connected Bluetooth call to another paired Bluetooth device. For example, switching between multiple mobile phones to select the desired communication device.

name: Panoramic Image View Switching
description: Switch viewing angles for panoramic images (360° images). The system supports switching to Front View, Rear View, Left View, Right View, Front Dual View, Rear Dual View, and Wheel Arch View, allowing users to view corresponding directional image feeds. Views support both 2D AVM (Around View Monitor) and 3D AVM. 'Front Dual View' displays images of both front wheel arches, also called Front Wheel Arch View, Front Left/Right View, or Front Bilateral View. 'Rear Dual View' displays images of both rear wheel arches, also called Rear Wheel Arch View, Rear Left/Right View, or Rear Bilateral View. Typical usage scenarios:  When users want to view realtime recorded images of a specific direction, use this function to switch to corresponding positional view. Example: "Show front view" indicates switching to Front View.  When users want to check front wheel arches, switch to 'Front Dual View'.  When users want to check rear wheel arches, switch to 'Rear Dual View'.

value.description: Target image view for switching. Defaults to 2D when not specified as 2D or 3D.

name: Remote Control Unlock Mode Control
description: Set the remote unlock mode for vehicle keys, with options for driver side only or all doors. This feature allows users to configure whether remote unlocking applies only to the driver's side doors or all vehicle doors. Typically used when users need enhanced security or quick access to the vehicle.

mode.description: Unlock mode options: driver side only or all doors.

name: Highvoltage Battery SOC Percentage Setting
description: Set the absolute value of highvoltage battery SOC percentage, which configures the reserved remaining charge level. This allows users to set a reserved charge level to prevent sudden power loss during vehicle operation.

value.description: Highvoltage battery SOC percentage represented as:  n%, indicating remaining charge percentage relative to total capacity. For example, '20%' means reserving 20% charge.

name: 5G Data Traffic Switch Control
description: Enable or disable vehicle data traffic (5G network connection) functionality. When users need to access highspeed data services, activate 5G network through this feature to enjoy smoother online experiences.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sentry Mode Video Viewing
description: Open or view video recordings from Sentry Mode.

name: Microphone Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's microphone (handset).

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Central Lock Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle central lock. Opening the central lock will simultaneously lock all car doors, windows and trunk. Users can complete the locking of all doors, windows and trunk with a single operation without needing to manually operate each lock individually.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Activating the central lock switch indicates locking the central lock, while deactivating it indicates unlocking the central lock.

name: Scheduled Photo Capture
description: Enable or disable scheduled photo capture. When enabled, it helps users take photos at fixed intervals (3s) based on the previously memorized viewing angle.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Fragrance Scent Configuration
description: Configure or switch specific fragrance scent types.
usage: This function selects the closest matching scent from preset options based on user input. For example:  For tea fragrance, choose 'Graceful Spring Day'.
extra_rag_text: Available scent options include [Sea Breeze of Gothenburg/Burning Passion Moment/Graceful Spring Day/Fresh Morning Dawn/Free Exploration/Passionate Desert/The Fifth Element/Pure Magnolia/Worryfree Return/Arctic Green Pear/Ultimate Awakening Green Tea]

action.description: Switch status including [on, off, switch].

value.description: Specify fragrance type. Select the closest matching scent type from available options based on user input.

name: Window Lock Switch Control
description: Open or close the window lock. The window lock prevents passengers (especially children) from accidentally opening the windows during vehicle movement. For example, 'close the window lock' indicates closing the window lock.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Turning on the window lock switch means locking the windows, turning off the window lock switch means unlocking the windows.

position.description: Effective invehicle position(s), output must be a list. When seat position cannot be determined, do not fabricate information  must output default value ["CUR"].

name: Vehicle Hotspot Connection and Settings Page
description: Open or close the vehicle's hotspot settings/connection page. This feature can be activated when users need to connect or configure the vehicle hotspot, allowing access to related settings pages.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

page.description: Output 'page' when accessing connection interface; output 'settings' when accessing configuration interface

name: Window Lock Settings Page
description: Open or close the window lock settings page. Opening the window lock settings page allows users to adjust related window lock configurations according to personal preferences.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Vehicle Lock & Key Settings Page
description: Open or close the vehicle lock & key settings page. Opening the vehicle lock & key settings page allows users to view or manually modify functions related to vehicle locks and keys. '"Unify those vehicle lock and key settings for me"' indicates opening this page.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Automatic Window Closing on Vehicle Lock
description: Enable or disable the automatic window closing feature after vehicle lock. When enabled, automatically closes all windows after user locks the vehicle, preventing users from forgetting to close windows.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Parking Auto Unlock
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's parking auto unlock feature. When the vehicle is in parking status (i.e., parked state), this feature can automatically identify and judge conditions to release the door lock status. Typical scenarios:  Driver parks in busy parking lot and exits vehicle without manual door unlocking operation  Vehicle automatically enters door unlock state for exit.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Delayed Recording
description: Enable or disable delayed recording and scheduled recording. When delayed recording is enabled, users don't need to open the camera app  the system will wait 3 seconds and start recording based on the last memorized camera angle. This feature helps users prepare for recording.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

value.description: Countdown time for delayed recording in seconds, format 'HH:MM:SS'. Default NULL when time is not set.

name: Incar Voice Call Switch
description: Enable or disable the incar voice call function.

name: Suspension Easy Access Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the suspension easy access feature. The suspension easy access controls vehicle height adjustment, allowing drivers and passengers of shorter stature to enter/exit the vehicle more comfortably by adjusting suspension height for easier access.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.
mapping_rules: User requires easier access due to short stature  on

name: Door Handle Touch Unlock Mode Control
description: Configure door handle touch unlock mode, including setting to unlock current door (driverside) or all vehicle doors, applicable for different vehicle safety requirements.

position.description: Unlock mode with optional values [driverside, all].

name: Sentry Mode Switch Control
description: Turn on or off Sentry Mode. When activating vehicle's Sentry Mode, it will continuously monitor vehicle status. Upon detecting any anomalies such as broken windows, collisions, etc., the vehicle will trigger alarms and play music to warn potential intruders. Additionally, Sentry Mode activates cameras for surveillance recording. If the vehicle suffers damage, owners can use these video recordings as evidence for subsequent investigations. Note: Sentry Mode is not equivalent to 360degree panoramic imaging.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Main Exterior Light Settings Page Control
description: Open or close the exterior light settings page. Specifically controls the main exterior light settings pages including:  Fog light settings  Rear fog light settings  Parking light settings  Headlight settings  High beam settings  Position light/width light settings  Warning light settings  Allweather light settings  Headlamp settings  Door control light settings  Adaptive front headlight settings  Gear position illumination light settings.
usage: Open the main exterior light settings page when users want to check what specific adjustments are available for a particular exterior light. Open the corresponding exterior light settings when needing to check adjustable functions of specific exterior lights.
extra_rag_text: Examples: 'Check warning light settings' indicates opening the warning light settings page; 'What can fog lights adjust? Open to view' opens fog light settings page; 'What adjustments are available for headlights? I want to configure' indicates opening headlight settings page.  Open high beam settings for me.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

light_type_outside.description: Optional values: [fog light, front fog light, rear fog light, parking light, headlight, high beam, position light, warning light, allweather light, headlamp, door control light, adaptive front headlight, gear position illumination light].

name: Child AntiAddiction Control
description: Enable or disable the child antiaddiction feature.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off].

name: Photography
description: Enable or disable the invehicle photography functionality. This feature can help users create photo records at any time. When users require photography, e.g. 'take a photo inside the vehicle' or 'help me take a photo', it indicates activating the invehicle photography.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. For example, output 'on' when users require photography.

position.description: Photography position with options [incar, NULL]. Output 'NULL' when position is unspecified by user.

name: Camera Mode Switching
description: Switch camera modes, including care mode, global mode, and focus mode.

description: Open or close Child Mode.

description: Open or close the sound effects settings page, allowing users to adjust audio effects for multimedia, navigation, Bluetooth earphones, voice, phone calls, and call ringtones. This function enables opening the sound effects settings page where users can independently adjust audio effects from various sources to accommodate personal preferences or requirements in different environments.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Headrest Screen Brightness Mode Adjustment
description: Adjust the brightness mode of the headrest screen, supporting configuration for daytime or nighttime modes.
usage: This feature allows adjustment of the headrest screen's brightness mode to adapt to different lighting environments (e.g. daytime or nighttime) for a more comfortable viewing experience.

mode.description: Brightness mode. 'daytime' represents daytime mode, 'nighttime' represents nighttime mode.

position.description: Target seat position(s) in the vehicle. Output must be a list. When seat position cannot be determined, output default value ["CUR"]. Do not hallucinate positions.

name: Navigation Volume Settings Page
description: Open or close the navigation volume settings page. Opening this page allows users to view and manually modify navigation volumerelated functions.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Charging Port Cover Switch Control
description: Open or close the charging port cover switch. Charging port covers include four types: charging port cover, AC charging port cover, DC charging port cover, and AC/DC charging port cover. Fast charging corresponds to DC charging, slow charging corresponds to AC charging. Use this function when users need quick access to open/close the charging port cover.

feature.description: Current type of charging port cover, available options: [NULL, AC, DC, AC/DC]. Output 'NULL' when user doesn't specify charging port cover type.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sentry Mode Settings Page
description: Open or close the Sentry Mode settings page. Opening the Sentry Mode settings page allows users to view and manually interact with vehicle monitoring and safetyrelated functions.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Sentry Mode Nonfolding Rearview Mirror Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the nonfolding rearview mirror feature in Sentry Mode. The nonfolding rearview mirror function in Sentry Mode refers to keeping rearview mirrors unfolded when the vehicle is locked.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. When parameter is 'on', keep rearview mirrors unfolded (nonfolding rearview mirror) in Sentry Mode or vehicle lock state. When parameter is 'off', close rearview mirror extension (folded rearview mirror) in Sentry Mode or vehicle lock state.

name: Energy Management App
description: Open or close the system's energy management application (settings page). When opened, users can view or manually configure batteryrelated and scheduled charging functions based on their needs. Typical scenarios:  When users want to charge their vehicle during cheaper electricity periods at night, e.g., 'Cheaper charging at night, help me set up scheduled charging', use this function to enter the Energy Management App for detailed manual configuration of scheduled charging features.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Rear Wing Height Adjustment
description: Adjust the rear wing height up or down, supporting height level adjustments including high, mid, and low.

value.description: Rear wing height adjustment value with options [high, mid, low].

name: Driving Assistance Function Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's driving assistance function. Driving assistance functions include pedestrian alert and pedestrian courtesy. 'Pedestrian Alert' can remind both pedestrians and users, helping drivers stay focused. 'Pedestrian Courtesy' assists users in making correct decisions by reminding them to yield to pedestrians.

function.description: Assistance function options. Available options: [pedestrian alert, pedestrian courtesy].

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Voice Volume Settings Page
description: Open or close the voice volume settings page. Opening the voice volume settings page allows users to view and manually adjust relevant voice volume functions.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

description: Enable or disable the game controller gestures control functionality.

name: Proximity Unlock
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's proximity unlock feature. This feature allows users to unlock doors automatically when approaching the vehicle with only a smart key or supported device (e.g. smartphone), eliminating the need to retrieve keys from pockets or bags. Typical scenarios:  Proximity unlock significantly simplifies vehicle entry process when users are carrying multiple items or under inclement weather conditions.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

description: Control the exterior speaker to play sound effects as lion roar.

description: Open or close the child lock settings page. Opening the child lock settings page allows users to adjust related configurations according to personal preferences.

The 'video recording' feature allows users to capture video records at any time without opening the camera app, automatically initiating recording based on the last memorized perspective. When users want to record the incar atmosphere, enable the incar video recording feature. Example: 'Record an incar video segment' activates incar video recording.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

position.description: Recording location options: [incar, external, NULL]. Output 'NULL' when user doesn't specify location.

action.description: Mute switch status. Output 'on' when opening mute or turning off sound; Output 'off' when closing mute or turning on sound.

name: Charging Gun Temperature Control Switch
description: Turn on or off the charging gun temperature control function. When enabled, it maintains the temperature of the charging port after the charging gun is connected to prevent overheating risks.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Door Lock Settings Page
description: Open or close the door lock settings page. action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

description: Switch sound effects for immersive scenarios, including ocean waves, wind, and rain sounds.

name: Fuel Charging Switch Control
description: Open or close the vehicle's fuel charging function, which uses fuel to charge the vehicle. When the vehicle has a low battery level and is in a fuelavailable environment, the fuel charging function can be activated to ensure the vehicle can continue driving.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when the action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Power Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the vehicle power and power sockets.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Navigation Auto Volume Reduction Switch Control
description: Enable or disable the navigation auto volume reduction feature. During driving, enabling this function helps improve the clarity of navigation voice prompts and prevents conflicts with multimedia volume. Users can disable this feature when they don't want multimedia volume to decrease during navigation announcements.

enum: Multimedia volume reduction during navigation announcements

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Button Sound Effects Switch Control
description: Turn on or off the button sound effects on the screen.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: System Volume Mute Control
description: Enable or disable the invehicle system volume mute function. Close the mute function when system sound needs to be activated or audio playback needs to be resumed. Enable mute function when system sound needs to be disabled. Allows drivers to activate system mute during operation to avoid distraction.

action.description: Mute status including 'on' (enable mute) and 'off' (disable mute). 'on' indicates activating system mute (no audio playback), 'off' indicates canceling mute (resuming audio playback). Example: user says "why is there no system sound, disable mute" should output 'off'.

name: Remote Lock
description: Enable or disable the vehicle's remote lock feature. The remote lock feature automatically locks the doors at a preset distance when the user leaves the vehicle and walks away, enhancing convenience and security.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Outputs default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Ambient Light Mode and Color Adjustment
description: Adjust or switch interior ambient light colors/modes to change cabin ambiance. 1. Adjust ambient light colors allowing users to switch cabin ambient lighting for different moods/scenarios  e.g., switching to soft blue at night for tranquility, bright natural colors during daytime for illumination, and deep colors like red at night to minimize circadian rhythm disruption. 2. Adjust ambient light modes (themes) to create different cabin atmospheres.
usage: Open [color] ambient light, e.g. 'open green ambient light' indicates adjusting to corresponding color.  'Create a xxx atmosphere' indicates setting ambient light to corresponding mode/color. When no suitable mode exists, use nearest matching color to create specified ambiance.  'Switch to theme color' indicates setting mode to 'theme color'.
extra_rag_text: Activate ambient lights in breathing mode. Flashing lights indicate ambient lighting. Interior colored lighting refers to ambient lights.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off, switch].

value.description: Ambient light color (must select from enum values).  Map to nearest enum color when user describes undefined colors/ambiances  Output 'N/A' for unrecognizable colors  Output 'NULL' when color unspecified.

mode.description: Ambient light mode (select from enum values).  Output 'custom' for userdefined modes  Output 'NULL' when mode unspecified.

position.description: Vehicle position(s) for adjustment (must be list). Output default CUR when position unclear.

description: Enable or disable incar spatial sound effect/sound field mode/intelligent sound field (Panoramic Sound, Immersive Surround Sound, etc.). Default spatial sound effect coverage area is the entire vehicle.

usage: AVM (also called 360 imaging, 360, or threesixty) can display vehicle surroundings on the incar screen, assisting drivers in observing environmental conditions. Note: This function can only activate the imaging interface and cannot switch camera perspectives.  Users may activate 360degree imaging when reversing or exiting parking spaces to avoid collisions.
extra_rag_text: AVM = Panoramic Imaging. Example: Turn off the AVM for me

Use this feature to enable system mute for multimedia during driving to avoid distractions.

action.description: Mute status including [on, off]. 'on' indicates enabling multimedia mute (no audio playback); 'off' indicates disabling mute (resuming audio playback). Example: 'radio audio playback' outputs 'off'.

module.description: Multimedia module options: multimedia, radio, video, music.

name: Multimedia Sound Settings Page
description: Open or close the multimedia system sound settings pages, including music sound settings page, radio sound settings page, video sound settings page, and multimedia sound settings page.

module.description: Multimedia module options: multimedia, radio, video, music.

CSD represents primary Bluetooth, PSD represents front passenger seat Bluetooth. Related scenarios: Use this function when users experience ear discomfort and need to disable Bluetooth.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Exterior Scenery Recording
description: Used for recording exterior scenery videos along the vehicle's route. The 'Exterior Scenery Recording' feature fulfills users' need to record exterior scenery videos without opening mobile camera apps, preserving beautiful scenic footage during journeys. For example, '，。' indicates activating exterior scenery recording.

action.description: Switch status including [on, off]. Output default value 'N/A' when action cannot be determined as on/off.

name: Multimedia Volume Adjustment
description: Adjust the multimedia volume level inside the vehicle, supporting operations to set multimedia to specified volume levels/percentage, increase/decrease multimedia volume, or set multimedia volume to maximum/minimum values.

value.description: Multimedia volume adjustment value with three representation formats:  When setting to specified volume, use absolute percentage (1%99%) or level number (1n).  When increasing/decreasing volume, use [+/percentage] or [+/integer] format (integer range [1, n], percentage range [1%99%]), where '+' indicates increase and '' indicates decrease.  When setting extreme values, use [max, min] where 'max' means maximum and 'min' means minimum.

module.description: Multimedia module options: multimedia, radio, video, music.

name: Navigation Volume Adjustment
description: Adjust incar navigation volume level, supporting setting navigation volume to specified gear positions/percentage values, increasing/decreasing volume, or setting navigation volume to maximum/minimum values.

value.description: Navigation volume adjustment value with three representation formats:  When setting to specific volume, use absolute percentage or gear values (gear range [1, n], percentage range [1%, 99%]).  For volume increase/decrease, use [+/ percentage] or [+/ integer] format (integer range [1, n], percentage range [1%, 99%]), where '+' indicates volume up and '' indicates volume down.  For extreme values, optional [max, min] where 'max' represents maximum value and 'min' represents minimum value.

name: WiFi Connection and Settings Page

page.description: Output 'page' when needing to access the connection page; output 'settings' when needing to access the settings page

description: Modify the active zone of current invehicle spatial sound mode. This function allows switching current sound effects to specified vehicle zones. For example, switching from wholevehicle sound to driverseat sound or rearseat sound to achieve better personalized auditory experience.

name: Headrest Sound Mode Settings
description: Set the playback mode for headrest sound. This feature supports configuration (switching) of four modes: Driver Priority Mode, Shared Mode, Private Mode, Full Cabin Private Mode. The headrest sound mode refers to the vehicle's builtin sound system integrated in the headrests.
